value: At Sea, - signalling a passing Steamer

label: Description
value: Horizontal view at night showing the starboard side of the fore portion of a vessel and foremast.  Four men, in nautical uniform, on bridge, and two skyrockets ascending.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson [according to original catalogue card]
The Wreck of the "Atlantic" – Cast up by the Sea

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of rocky seacoast with boulders, with the figure of a woman in nightdress lying full length in the foreground, while beyond her, looking downward, is a man with a boathook, and in distance, at right, are a point of land with figures and foundered steamship.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson
Our Watering Places - The Empty Sleeve at Newport

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a wicker trap containing a woman and man with military cap of the Northern United States at the time of the Civil War; his left coat is empty and pinned under his lapel.  Beach is visible in the distance, and the ocean beyond.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson

label: Description
value: Vertical view at left of the corner of a house with an open door showing portion of interior where a table is laid for a meal, at center of a woman with her back turned blowing trumpet, and in the distance beyond a well with sweep and a field with workers.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson

label: Description
value: Two horizontal pictures on upright page:  Upper shows a sidewalk with pedestrians whose clothes are being blown by wind, and the lower shows another sidewalk, with buildings, traffic in the street, and promenaders walking in rain.  Four columns of verse divide the two pictures.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson
New York Charities - St. Barnabas House, 304 Mulberry Street

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle containting four vignettes: Upper left shows two young women, with one knocking at door marked: "St. Barnabas"; upper center shows a woman wearing a cap and apron, and holding a key, framed by a doorway; upper right shows three women; and the lower shows a room with young women seated in groups, some about a center table.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson
Bathing at Long Branch, "Oh, ain't it cold !"

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of three girls in bathing suits in the water, and an indication in the right distance of two more figures in the water.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson
Watch-tower, Corner of Spring and Varick Streets, New York

label: Description
value: Upright page containing five scenes:  At top is the interior of an observation room with a seated man in uniform looking through a telescope; at center below is a view of a circular staircase and a platform with a large bell; at lower left is a view of the whoe tower; and at lower right is a man ringing a bell and a fire engine going through a street during the night;

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving printed in black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Mrs. Cora E. Wilson

label: Description
value: Vining floral design. Many different species of brightly colored flowers growing off a meandering vine. Painted on medium green ground.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of McDougall Hawkes

label: Description
value: Motif of bats flying in multiple directions cut from brown paper, their wings interlaced to form a continuous pattern. There are faint silk threads visible throughout the negative space to reinforce the overall structure.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon juice (kakishibu), silk threads (itoire)

label: Provenance
value: Charles W. Gould; 1939: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Charles W. Gould

label: Description
value: A single piece of bamboo or (take) is curved diagonally with sprigs of leaves naturally dispersed around the shoot. Silk threads have been added to support the overall structure.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu), and silk threads (itoire)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Charles W. Gould

label: Description
value: Interlaced circles or "Seven-treasures" (shippo) is an appropriation of older motifs. Shippō is an auspicious design which is a popular motif on women's kimonos, primarily worn in times of need of good luck, such as weddings and new year's. Drill punching and pull carving have been applied to create this detailed motif. There is a bit of staining located near the bottom of the image.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Charles W. Gould

value:
(a) Ornament of three scrolls formed of glass beads and outlined with cord. 
(b) Ornamental ring with pendants formed of glass beads and silk and metal cord

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal threads, glass beads

label: Description
value: Roll composed of six sections of silk sewed end to end; one end pasted to paper on wooden roll, other pasted to paper serving as cover and bearing inscription.  Silk printed with 105 small-scale repeating patterns, largely in dot and lozenge designs, in white on a blue ground.  Patterns are in rectangles of various widths, arranged in five lengthwise bands.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: resist printed on ribbed plain weave

label: Notes
value: Roll composed of six sections of silk sewed end to end; one end pasted to paper on wooden roll, other pasted to paper serving as cover and bearing inscription. label: Description
value:
Each shows the teapot with the handle at right, on top, the cream pot with the
handle at left, bottom left, the two-handled and covered sugar bowl, bottom
right. The handles of the cream pots and augar bowls are forked on top.
Reverse: blackened for tracing. The knobs of the covers are shaped like urns.
Rough sketch of a pendant(?) top right. Marked, ink,"#38.• Written, bottom
left: "Tracing, "pencil
